result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • James Patrick Long was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty Chapman acknowledged receipt of information.  DEF entered NG plea.  Continues to Plea/Sentencing.

Atty Chapman indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.    Moves to Arraignment.

1:38 PM Defendant James Patrick Long in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for James Patrick Long.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  State indicates there has been no waiver of preliminary hearing or arraignment.  Attny Chapman indicates DEF is prepared to waive preliminary hearing.   Court moves to waiver of preliminary hearing and arraignment.    State recites agreement.  All parties agree.  Court reviews filed information, DEF enters NG Plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1 and finds DEF guilty.  Court 2 is merged and dismissed by operation of law.  State makes statement prior to sentencing.   Attny Chapman makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF no comment to court.  Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.  Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  Withheld sentence:  2 years probation:  Conditions of probation:   60 days Conditional Jail time - Good Time and Huber Privileges.  DEF to report immediately.  3 days credit.   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  Fine/Costs $2,323.00   DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. 36 months of Driver license revocation / Lifetime Driver License Revocation, DOT to credit any administrative suspension and add any period of incarceration to revocation sentence.  36 months  IID requirement, On any vehicle owned or operated.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjournment Request (forwarded to JA for Judge's consideration)

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:08 AM   Defendant James P. Long  in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Christian Ness  (special appearance) appear in court by video.  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE does not  qualify for PD appointment.   Received notification from Public Defenders Office, DEF does not qualify for PD appointment, and was given instructions to contact Clerk of Court Office to apply for court appointed attorney.  State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Ness  argues bond.  DEF makes statement.  Court has discussion with DEF.  Court sets bond.
